title: Crossing the Red Sea
shortSummary: Exodus 14 recounts the dramatic deliverance of Israel from Egyptian pursuit through the miraculous parting of the Red Sea. This chapter highlights God's sovereign power, His faithfulness to His people, and His glory revealed through judgment on Egypt and salvation for Israel.

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The appointed leader of Israel who communicates God's instructions and performs signs to deliver the people.

keyCharacters.name: Pharaoh
keyCharacters.description: The king of Egypt whose hardened heart leads him to pursue Israel, resulting in his army's destruction.

keyCharacters.name: Children of Israel
keyCharacters.description: The descendants of Jacob who are delivered from slavery and witness God's miraculous salvation.

keyCharacters.name: Angel of God
keyCharacters.description: The divine presence that leads and protects Israel, moving from before to behind the camp to shield them.

definitions.definition: A location near the Red Sea where Israel encamped before crossing; its exact location is uncertain but it marks the site of the miraculous deliverance.
God's sovereign act of strengthening Pharaoh's resolve to oppose Israel, demonstrating divine control over human will for His purposes.
A fast, horse-drawn vehicle used in ancient warfare, symbolizing Egyptian military power.
Manifestations of God's presence guiding and protecting Israel by day (cloud) and by night (fire).

outline.heading: God’s Instructions and Pharaoh’s Pursuit
outline.description: God commands Israel to camp by the sea, anticipating Pharaoh’s pursuit, which He orchestrates by hardening Pharaoh’s heart to display His power and glory.

outline.heading: Israel’s Fear and Moses’ Assurance
outline.description: Faced with imminent danger, Israel doubts and fears, but Moses encourages them to trust in the LORD’s salvation and to remain calm.

outline.heading: God’s Command to Move Forward and the Divine Strategy
outline.description: God instructs Moses to lead Israel forward and positions His angel and the pillar of cloud to protect Israel and confuse the Egyptians.

outline.heading: The Parting of the Red Sea
outline.description: Through Moses’ outstretched hand and a strong east wind, God miraculously divides the sea, creating a dry path for Israel’s escape.

outline.heading: The Destruction of the Egyptian Army
outline.description: The Egyptians pursue into the sea but are incapacitated by God, who causes the waters to return and drown Pharaoh’s entire army.

outline.heading: Israel’s Deliverance and Response
outline.description: Israel safely crosses on dry ground, witnesses the destruction of their enemies, and responds with fear, faith, and belief in the LORD and Moses.

application: Trust God’s deliverance even when circumstances seem impossible, remembering He fights on behalf of His people.
Stand firm in faith and do not give in to fear when facing trials, relying on God’s promises and power.
Obey God’s commands promptly, even when the path forward is unclear, trusting His sovereign plan.
Recognize God’s glory revealed through both salvation and judgment, leading to reverent faith and obedience.

keyVerses.text: The LORD shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes God’s role as the defender of His people and calls believers to trust and rest in Him.

keyVerses.text: And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the LORD caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the miraculous power of God to save His people through supernatural means.

keyVerses.text: And Israel saw that great work which the LORD did upon the Egyptians: and the people feared the LORD, and believed the LORD, and his servant Moses.
keyVerses.significance: This verse shows the result of God’s mighty acts—faith and reverence toward God and His appointed leader.
